p: In spite of the severe epidemic, the Egyptian Ministry of Agriculture refuses to announce this epizootic till the present time. However, as of 28 August 2003, WHO received reports of 45 cases of Rift Valley fever (RVF) including 17 deaths in Seedy Salim district, a remote rural area in Kafr Al-Sheikh governorate, about150 km north of Cairo. All cases are Egyptian farmers. Laboratory testing carried out at the Naval Medical Research Unit No.3 (NAMRU-3), Cairo, has confirmed the diagnosis of RVF in clinical samples. A gradual increase in the number of suspected cases of RVF in Seedy Salim district has been reported as a result of active surveillance [ 32].
